description: From Middle English awakenen or awaknen, from Old English awæcnan or awæcnian, from a- plus wæcnan or wæcnian.

verbs.description: awaken (third-person singular simple present awakens, present participle awakening, simple past and past participle awakened) (but see usage notes)

examples: She awakened him by ringing the bell.
Each morning he awakens with a smile on his face.

entries.meaning: (transitive, figurative) To bring into action (something previously dormant); to stimulate.
examples: We hope to awaken your interest in our programme.

entries.meaning: (theology) To call to a sense of sin.

examples: [This ant] I ſuffered to lye above an hour in the Spirit; and after I had taken it out, and put its body and legs into a natural poſture, remained moveleſs about an hour; but then , upon a ſudden, as if it had been awaken out of a drunken ſleep, it ſuddenly reviv'd and ran away...
